an9.44:4.1: “Reverend, they speak of a person called ‘freed by wisdom’.
an9.44:4.2: What is the one freed by wisdom that the Buddha spoke of?”
an9.44:5.1: “First, take a mendicant who, quite secluded from sensual pleasures …
an9.44:5.2: enters and remains in the first absorption. And they understand that with wisdom.
an9.44:5.3: Thus far the Buddha spoke of the direct witness in a qualified sense. …
an9.44:6.1: Furthermore, take a mendicant who, going totally beyond the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception, enters and remains in the cessation of perception and feeling. And, having seen with wisdom, their defilements come to an end. And they understand that with wisdom.
an9.44:6.2: Thus far the Buddha spoke of the one freed by wisdom in an unqualified sense.”
